Class Library

java.lang.Object
Library
public class Library
extends java.lang.Object
Library Represents the Library object that will be used to store users, devices, and resources as well as functionality to manipulate data within these objects stored.
Since:
2020-11-27
Version:
1.0
Author:
James Welsh

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Library()
    Takes no parameters and creates a generic library with the name 'name'.

    • containsResource

      public boolean containsResource​(Resource resource)
      Check that library contains resource object.
      Parameters:
      resource - The resource object to search for.
      Returns:
      returns true if resource found and false otherwise.

    • containsLibraryMember

      public boolean containsLibraryMember​(LibraryMember member)
      Check that library contains member object.
      Parameters:
      member - The LibraryMember object to search for.
      Returns:
      true if member is found, false otherwise.

    • editResourceTitle

      public void editResourceTitle​(Resource resource, java.lang.String newTitle)
      Parameters:
      resource - The Resource object to edit the title of.
      newTitle - The new string to set the title to.

    • findResource

      public Resource findResource​(Resource resource)
      Searches for resource and returns appropriate value.
      Parameters:
      resource - the Resource object to search for.
      Returns:
      returns the Resource object if found or null otherwise.

      Searches for and prints Books with the ISBN searched for.
      Parameters:
      ISBN - The string representing the ISBn to search for.

      Parameters:

      Remove resource by index.
      Parameters:

    • printAvailableBooks

      prints all available books in an easy to read format.

      public int numberOfResources()
      Returns the number of resources in the library.
      Returns:
      the integer representing the number of resources.

    • addResource

      public void addResource​(Resource resource)
      Adds a resource to the library.
      Parameters:
      resource - The Resource object to add. Cannot be null.

    • addLibraryMember

      public void addLibraryMember​(LibraryMember member)
      Adds a member to the library.
      Parameters:
      member - The LibraryMember object to add. Cannot be null.

    • addElectronicDevice

      public void addElectronicDevice​(ElectronicDevice device)
      Adds a device to the library.
      Parameters:
      device - The ElectronicDevice object to add.

    • lendBook

      public void lendBook​(Book book, LibraryMember member)
      Lends a book to a member provided all checks are passed.
      Parameters:
      book - Must belong to the library, not be null and be currently available.
      member - Must belong to the library, not be null, and have less than 5 books currently on loan.

    • returnBook

      public void returnBook​(Resource book, boolean addDamages, java.lang.String damages)
      Returns a book to the library and records damages if needed.
      Parameters:
      book - Must be currently on loan, not null, and belong to the library.
      addDamages - A boolean. true if damages are to be added and false otherwise.
      damages - The string representing the new damage to add to the books damages string.

    • sendMessage

      public void sendMessage​(java.lang.String message)
      Sends a message to all LibraryMembers belonging to the library that currently have a book on loan.
      Parameters:
      message - The message string to send to members.

    • printAllPhysicalResources

      public void printAllPhysicalResources()
      prints all physical resources (Books) in an easy to read format.

    • printAllElectronicResources

      public void printAllElectronicResources()
      prints all electronic resources in an easy to read format.
